TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MenuRenderingMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the control renders HTML elements and inline styles, or elements and cascading style sheet (CSS) styles.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the MenuRenderingMode enumeration when you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.RenderingMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The value that you assign to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.RenderingMode%2A> property determines how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control renders markup.
In ASP.NET 3.5 and earlier versions, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses HTML `table` elements and inline styles to control the appearance of the menu in a browser. In ASP.NET 4 and later versions, by default the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses `listitem` elements and cascading style sheet (CSS) styles. This enumeration is provided for backward compatibility. In ASP.NET 4 and later versions, you can use this enumeration to specify that you want the menu control to generate markup the way it does in earlier versions of ASP.NET.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuRenderingMode Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The control renders markup in the way it does by default for the version of ASP.NET indicated by the property of the control. If the value of the property is 3.5, this setting is equivalent to Table. If the value of the property is 4.0 or greater, this setting is equivalent to List.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuRenderingMode List = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The control renders markup by using list item () elements and CSS styles.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuRenderingMode Table = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The control renders markup by using elements and inline styles.
